Clue.name: Exterior lights, Passenger/safety lights, Emergency lights, Glareshield ice detect lights
STBY FLT DISPLAY Switch amber light extinguished
Verify emergency bus items
If both engines running
No displays powered (External power MUST be disconnected)
Minimum BATT VOLT 24 (External power MUST be disconnected)
Cyan light illuminated
Amber light illuminated
Do not operate TAIL DEICE when SAT is below -30deg C
Limit ground operation of pitot/static heat to 2 minutes to prevent damage to the pitot/static heaters
PITOT heat - OFF, WING/ENG heat - OFF, TAIL heat - OFF ENG ONLY heat - as requred
Do not operate WING/ENG ANTI-ICE on the ground at high engine rpm after anti-ice messages have cleared. Do not operate TAIL DEICE when SAT is below -30deg C

CheckpointDesc.ExpectationTT: On/CAS Message Clears then After 30 Seconds, Off

Clue.name: To achieve 10deg initial pitch Use flight director TO mode
Verify button illuminates
Verify button illuminates
Repeat steps 2 through 5 Caution: Do not start second engine with operating engine generator off
If a no braking condition is encountered during taxi, use the emergency brake. If the emergency brake is used, maintenance is required before flight
Towing airplane with control lock engaged may damage nosewheel steering mechanism
Indicator within TO band
CHECK indicators for proper door pin position, no CABIN DOOR message and handle latched
At least 10 minutes after shutdown
After engines have cooled
For BATT DISC check in Cockpit/Cabin Inspection
Secure/Clear/Lock Pin Removed/Cover In Place
Behind aft left passenger seat

CheckpointDesc.SubjectTT: Collins Pro Line 21 Avionics System Pilots Guide for CJ4

Clue.name: As required in AFM Section II, Operating Limitations, or applicable AFM supplement
Iinboard side of copilot seat
Abort start if ITT rapidly approaches 1000deg C or shows no rise within 10 seconds. Abort start if N1 does not indicate rotation by 25% N2
If ADS-B Out required
Use flight director GA mode
v1, vR, v2, vENR (vT), takeoff field length and weight limits
Pilot, copilot, and standby: Within 50 feet of departure field elevation and within 75 feet of each other
Set landing field elevation

CheckpointDesc.SubjectTT: BATT VOLT (If External Power is re-connected)

Clue.name: For single-engine operation, selecting CLIMATE CONTROL to NORM or COMP ON may cause a generator overcurrent if the battery charging amps are greater than 100
If ADS-B Out is required
Push and Hold for 5 seconds - TEST light illuminates
